author: Phil Helsel
title: Montana governor latest to tell residents to stay home to slow spread of virus
description: Montana's governor issued a stay-at-home directive as a way to help slow the spread of the coronavirus that causes the illness COVID-19. The governor also said the state has seen its first death from the disease.
content:
Montana Gov. Steve Bullock issued a stay-at-home directive Thursday, which his office says requires residents to remain in their homes as much as possible and for nonessential businesses to temporarily close in order to slow the spread of the coronavirus.
